statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description:
Reggie Miller scored 13 of his 20 points in
the final 4:51 Sunday to lead the Indiana Pacers over the
injury-depleted Los Angeles Clippers 92-87.

related.description: Clippers center Michael Olowokandi went on the injured list Sunday with a sore left knee.
related.linkText: Olowokandi put on injured reserve with sore knee
related.title: Clippers lose Olowokandi for at least five games
related.headline: Clippers lose Olowokandi for at least five games

article.headline: Without Miller and Olowokandi, Clips fall short
article.linkText: Miller's late heroics propel Pacers over Clippers
article.story:
LOS ANGELES -- Indiana's Reggie Miller finds it difficult to pace himself.
Miller

In his fourth game back since being sidelined by a bone bruise on his right ankle, Miller scored 13 of his 20 points in the final 4:51 to lead the Pacers to a 92-87 victory over the injury-riddled Los Angeles Clippers on Sunday. Talking about being about being more of a role player than the go-to-guy for the Pacers now, the 37-year-old Miller said his ailing ankle also is a factor. "Now it's probably going to be worse because I'm playing more minutes,'' said Miller, who played 34 minutes against the Clippers. "I thought I was going to come back and play 20-25 minutes and call it a day, win or lose. "But once you get out there and start to sweat a little bit, I think there's a sense of urgency that we can actually win the game. Then I just say, 'Forget about my ankle; I'll worry about it later.''' Miller went 7-for-14 from the floor and made two of his seven 3-point tries. He made a 14-foot jumper to put Indiana up by a point with 1:17 remaining, added a 22-footer for an 88-85 edge 16 seconds later, then made two free throws for a 90-87 lead with 10.4 seconds left. After the Clippers' Keyon Dooling missed a 3-point try, Indiana's Ron Mercer was fouled and made two free throws to finish with 20 points. "I told the team before the game that it's not going to be pretty all the time offensively. We just need to concentrate and win games,'' Indiana coach Isiah Thomas said. Ron Artest added 13 points and 12 rebounds as Indiana, an Eastern Conference-best 14-2, won its fourth straight despite shooting 39 percent. Elton Brand led the Clippers, losers of eight of their last 11, with 20 points and 12 rebounds, and rookie Marko Jaric had 25 points. The Clippers, already missing Lamar Odom and Corey Maggette, placed center Michael Olowokandi on the injured list before the game with a sore left knee. Los Angeles point guard Andre Miller also was out, resting an ankle sprain that occurred in Friday night's loss at Sacramento. Jaric, the point guard from Yugoslavia's world championship team, started in Andre Miller's spot and went 8-of-16 from the floor and 8-of-8 from the line for his highest-scoring NBA game. Melvin Ely, a 6-foot-10 rookie out of Fresno State taken by the Clippers with the 12th pick in the draft, started at center and had six points and six rebounds in 16 minutes, with Sean Rooks taking over and playing 33 minutes, with four points. The Pacers trailed 73-66 with 6:41 remaining, but Miller and Mercer took over and Indiana went ahead 76-75 on Miller's 3-pointer with 4:51 left. The Clippers shot 36 percent, but missed a string of shots as they fell behind in the fourth quarter. "We've got to find a way to get the ball in the basket,'' Los Angeles coach Alvin Gentry said. "Down the stretch, we didn't make shots and they did.'' Game notes
The Clippers activated F Tremaine Fowlkes to fill Olowokandi's roster spot. ... The game was the start of a six-game road trip for the Pacers, who went 13-2 as they played 10 of their first 15 at home. ... The Clippers' Miller is listed day to day. ... Olowokandi, who missed part of training camp with knee problems, had been playing with pain for the past few games. ... Jaric had started at small forward two days earlier at Sacramento, scoring 19 points on 8-for-15 shooting.
